entry.title: Fragment from a letter
entry.summary: Fragment of a statue base. Inscribed on the face. Date: No description. Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (93.1); not reported subsequently. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 100, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 370 .

entry.title: Honours for a citizen (late Republic)
entry.summary: A ?white marble block, broken above and at the right; no measurements. Inscribed on the face. Date: First century B.C. (lettering, content). Recorded by Paris and Holleaux; not recorded subsequently. Published by Paris and Holleaux, BCH 9 (1885), 74-6, no. 5, whence Liermann pp. 9-14, and notes at Reinach 79; discussed by L. Robert, Etudes Anatoliennes 312-4, with BE 1938.396, Ant.Class. 66, 422, whence SEG 30, 1980.1245, RDGE 169, Bowersock, AJPh 91 (1970), 226. Published, from all these, by Reynolds, A&R 28 whence SEG 32, 1982.1097; BE 1983:387; discussed by Bowersock, Gnomon 56, 1984, 52 (on l. 2). From all these McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 25 .

entry.title: Posthumous honours for Theodotos son of Andronikos
entry.summary: White marble base without moulding (0.55 × 0.77), in two fragments: Upper part, a, lines 1-11, 0.55; lower part, b, lines 12-16, 0.80. The lower fragment had a deep groove in it when recorded in 1934; by 1973 the fragment to the right of this groove, in lines 14-15, had broken off. Inscribed on the face. Date: First half of second century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Upper fragment recorded by Gaudin (95); both parts recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 128-129, no. 56 (part); by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 490, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 536.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Posthumous honours for C. Julius Potitianοs and for Antonia Flaviane
entry.summary: No description; but ll.17 and 29 suggest that this was a statue base. No description. Date: First century A.D. (lettering). Lines 1-20 copied by Picenini (10102, f. 29)in 1705, whence Sherard, apparently corrected in 1716 (10101, f.29); fragments of the whole recorded by Gaudin (86, 93 a, b, c, d, g, e, f, h, k, l); not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh from Sherard papers, CIG 2786, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 283 ; fragments published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, upper part 94 (ll. 1-9), 95 (ll.11-23), 96 (22-24), 97 (ll. 23-30), 98 (ll. 17-21), 99 (ll.19-30), 101 (ll. 7-18), 121 (ll. 11-15), on which see Cormack, Notes 11 and 57 fig. 5, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 317 , L. Robert, Hellenica 13, 137 n.1.

entry.title: Funerary fragment from NE Walls
entry.summary: Fragment of an inscribed moulding (0.30 × 0.18 × 0.18). Inscribed in a single line along upper moulding. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1978 (78.4). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Funerary inscription for M. Aur. Zenon
entry.summary: No description. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (nomenclature). Recorded in 1705 twice by Sherard (10101, 9v, 26) and by Picenini ( 10102, 17, and, from Tisser, 71v). Published by Boeckh, CIG 2839, whence SEG 1980.1244 [[CHECK]], McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 465.

entry.title: Dedication for Emperors and Caesars
entry.summary: A white marble statue base shaft (0.42 × 1.77 × 0.46) which is broken below and at the top left-hand corner. The inscribed face was turned inwards when the stone was re-used, and has been revealed only by the collapse of the adjoining wall; only the upper part is visible, to about 0.70 from the upper edge. Inscribed on the face. Date: A.D. 293-311 (reigns). Photos. Copied by Paris and Holleaux; by Reichel, 5 June 1893 (R.I.12b); recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Paris & Holleaux, no. 9; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 9, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 152.

entry.title: Invocation for Konstantios
entry.summary: Inscribed on the face. Date: First half fourth century (content, location). Photos. Copied by Paris and Holleaux; recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Paris and Holleaux, BCH 9, 1885, 84, no. 14, whence Ramsay, Cities & Bishoprics 554, no. 424, Grégoire, IGC 253, Cabrol DACL. 14, col. 795, no. 18, Peterson, Heis Theos 78; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 459, whence Robert, Hellenica 13, 157; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 140 and plate xxxiii, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 647.

entry.title: Decree of honours for Pereitas
entry.summary: Fragment from a large white marble block with part of the right edge surviving (0.41 × 0.33 x c. 0.12). Inscribed on the face. Date: Late first century B.C. - early first century A.D. (terminology, lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1978 (78.3). Published by J. M. Reynolds, Mélanges M. Floriani Squarciapino, Arch.Classica 49 (1997), 423-8, whence M. Sève, BullEp 1999.92, SEG 1997.1553.

entry.title: Honours for Adrastos son of Adrastos, sacred victor
entry.summary: A plain white marble statue base shaft tapering slightly towards the top (1.24 x 0.63-0.64 x 0.65). Inscribed on the face. Date: First to second centuries A.D.(lettering). Photos. First copied by Paris and Holleaux; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Paris and Holleaux, no.4, whence republished by Liermann, Analecta 36; published by Roueché, PPA 66.

entry.title: Posthumous honours for Attinas son of Theodoros
entry.summary: A plain white marble block (0.82 × 0.75 × depth not measurable) broken at upper left corner and below. Inscribed on the face. Date: First century A.D. (lettering); or later (formulae). Photos. Recorded by Falkener; by Waddington; by K&R; by Gaudin (176); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Henzen, from Falkener, Ann. d. Inst. 23, 1852, 126-127, no. 6; by Waddington, LBW 1599; mentioned by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 120, no. 45; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 477, whence Hellenica 13, 178-180, BE 1966.398, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 247.

entry.title: Dedication of statues by Artemidoros Pedisas
entry.summary: White marble statue base without moulding (0.43 × 1.10 × 0.40). Inscribed on the face, whose edges are slightly recessed. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (prosopography, lettering). Photo. Recorded by Paris and Holleaux; by K&R (not in notebooks); by Gaudin (63); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Paris & Holleaux, 8; cited by Reinach, from Gaudin, 22; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8. 448, whence Hellenica 13, 118, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 149.

entry.title: Consolatory decree for Tatia Attalis
entry.summary: Two white marble blocks, one complete (a), one in two pieces (b and c) both with a drafted margin along the bottom but not the top edge. b + c also has drafted margins along both side edges, and a may have done, but it is damaged down the left side and broken away at the right. a (containing Column I) surviving width 0.67 x o.415 x depth (part buried) not less than 0.36, damaged along all edges, broken away at the upper left-hand corner and the whole right-hand side. b and c from the right and left lower sides of a block with a recessed border, containing Column II. b : left side, (0.42 × 0.40 × 0.455); c: right side, (0.25 × 0.415 × 0.46). Both are worn , particularly b. Inscribed on the face, in two columns. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering, prosopography). Photos. a recorded by Gaudin (81), and by the NYU expedition; b and c recorded by the NYU expedition, b in 1983 (83.178), c in 1990. a published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 9, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 20 ; whole text published by Joyce Reynolds and Charlotte Roueché, 'The funeral of Tatia Attalis of Aphrodisias', Ktéma 17 (1992, published 1996), 153-60, whence BullEp 1997.523, SEG 1995.1502. Comments by C. P. Jones, Proceedings of the American Philosophical Society 143 (1999), 597-600, whence SEG 50 2000.1097..

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Decree of honours for Attinas Meliton
entry.summary: A white marble block (H. 0.87, W 0.74) without moulding. Inscribed on the face. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Seen and partially copied by Waddington; by Kubitschek ( K III, 50, Abklatsch 36). Copied and a squeeze taken by Gaudin (159); recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Waddington, LBW 1594; by Reinach from Gaudin, 14, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 29 .

entry.title: Consolatory decree, on death of Titus Antonius Lysimachos Grypos
entry.summary: Two originally adjacent white marble blocks (a, 1.11, b, 1.32 . Both 0.77 high. No depth measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: 41-54 A.D. (reign). Photos. b copied by Picenini (10102, 19v-20 and, from Tisser, 62v-63) whence Sherard, (10101, 30-31); a and b copied by Falkener; a copied by Waddington; recorded by Gaudin (177); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. published by Boeckh, from Sherard (b only) CIG 2767; Henzen, from Falkener, no. 1; published by Waddington from these and his own copy, LBW 1604, whence Buresch, RhM 49, 1894, 430-431, A. Wilhelm, Beiträge, 315; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin, no. 15; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, 408, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 12 .

entry.title: Gameboard
entry.summary: Large white marble block. Clearly cut across the face. Date: Second-sixth century A.D. (context). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Roueché, Gameboards 17.i.

entry.title: Building inscription
entry.summary: A white marble architrave block. No description. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (79); not reported subsequently. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 27; not in PHI.

entry.title: Funerary fragment
entry.summary: Fragment of a white marble sarcophagus front (0.46 × 0.305 × 0.11) with, apparently, top edge surviving and perhaps lower edge. Inscribed on the surface of the surviving face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1979 (79.16, Walls 11). Unpublished.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Naikos
entry.summary: White marble tabella ansata (1.53 × 0.75 × 0.40) with pediment above containing boss. Below the tabella is a niche. Inscribed on either side of boss (l.1) and in tabella (ll.2 ff). Date: Second to third centuries A.D. Photo. Recorded by the MAMA expedition in 1934; by the NYU expedition. Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 538, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 512 .

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Gaius
entry.summary: White marble block, with right side complete (0.915 x 0.76 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 585, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 479.

entry.title: Funerary text for Tiberius Claudius M
entry.summary: Fragments (not joining) from the top of a white marble panel or sarcophagus front (0.27 thick). a from centre, b from right corner. Incribed on a single surface. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (Walls 2). Unpublished.

entry.title: Honours for T. Aelius Aurelius Menandros
entry.summary: No description, but very probably part of a statue base. No description. Date: A.D. 138-69 (emperor). Copied by Wood, notebook 14, f45; not reported subsequently. Published from Wood by Roueché, PPA 92.

entry.title: Honours for M. Aurelius os, long-distance runner
entry.summary: A plain white marble statue base shaft (1.18 x 0.545 x 0.67); the block is damaged above but the upper edge survives. Inscribed on the face; the opening formula must have been inscribed on a crowning feature. Date: Early third century, after A.D. 211 (contests). Photo. Recorded by Paris and Holleaux; by Kubitschek and Reichel (not in notebooks); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Paris and Holleaux, no. 1, whence Liermann, Analecta 28, Moretti, IAG 80; by J. M. R. Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA VIII. 521, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 261; by Roueché, PPA 70.

entry.title: Honours for Sextus Appuleius
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft (0.62 × 0.76 × 0.55); badly worn and chipped at all edges. Inscribed on one face. Date: 23/15 B.C. (career). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1973 (Walls 106). published by Reynolds, Aphrodisias & Rome, doc. 44, whence SEG 1982.1097, BE 1983.390, AnnEpig 1984.879, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 238.

entry.title: Building inscription, late Hellenistic
entry.summary: Right end fragment of a white marble architrave block (0.73 × 0.48 × 0.30). The fasciae have a drafted edge above, below, and at the end of the block; a moulding above has been chipped away for re-use. Inscribed on the two fasciae; the lettering impinges on the drafting. Date: Early first century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Copied by Reichel (RI.15); recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 530, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 365.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Funerary fragment
entry.summary: Large white marble block without moulding 1.90 × 0.87 × 0.42 from a built tomb. Inscribed on the exposed face in different hands; at least one text (a), began on a block above. Beside this, text b, to the right, is perhaps a casual graffito. To the left of a and b is inscribed text c, in an area which is damaged at the left side. Date: a. perhaps late first century B.C. or early Julio-Claudian; b. undateable; c. perhaps Julio-Claudian (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (Walls 165). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Building dedication to Zeus
entry.summary: Fragment of white marble architrave from a Doric entablature (0.42 × 0.375 × 0.245). The left side, although damaged, is probably an original edge. Inscribed on the exposed face; the text must have begun on preceding blocks. Date: First century B.C., probably triumviral, but possibly earlier (lettering). Photos. Copied by Kubitschek (K.III.36, Abklatsch 96); recorded by the NYU expedition in 1992 (92.3). published from Kubitschek's notes by Cormack, ABSA 59 (1964), 22 no. 19, whence L. Robert, AntClass (1966), 394 , BE 1967.548, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 135; mentioned by M-H Gates, AJA 98 (1994), 267-68, whence BullEp 1995.78, and published by R.R.R. Smith, Kazi Sonuçlari Toplantasi 15,2 (1993), 355 and 368, whence BullEp 1996.385, SEG 1994.864.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Dedication by M. Iulius Attalos, imperial freedman, to Aphrodite, the imperial house, and the Senate and People of Rome.
entry.summary: Large white marble block broken away at the right side, originally with moulding on all three surviving faces (1.52 x 0.99 x 0.54). inscribed on the reverse face. Date: First century A.D. (lettering, content). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1978 (Walls 108). Published by Reynolds, PCPS 206, 1980, 73-74, no. 2, whence SEG 1980.1253, BullEp 1982.355, AnnEpig 1980, 867; republished by Reynolds, Aphrodisias & Rome, doc. 54, whence SEG 1982.1097, BullEp 1983.391, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 150 .

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Funerary honours for Hermias Glykon, his wife Apphia, and their daughter Apphia
entry.summary: Two adjacent white marble blocks, with a moulding chipped away at the upper edge (2.10 × 0.79 × depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face, in three adjacent columns; i. to the left, followed by ii., then iii. The text runs across the joins between the blocks. Date: First to second century A.D. Photos. Recorded by Gaudin (17); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition (inv?). Published by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 125-127, no. 52 ; from the MAMA records, by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 471 (i), 470 (ii), 469 (iii), whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 425, 426, 485 .

entry.title: Posthumous honours for Dionysios son of Artemidoros
entry.summary: White marble statue base without moulding, with lower part still buried(0.57 × 0.86 measurable x 0.47); damaged along the upper edge since the eighteenth century. Inscribed on the face. Date: First century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Copied in 1705 by Sherard (10101, 16) and by Picenini (10102, 27v, and from Tisser 76v) and by Sherard in 1716 (10101, 121); by Deering (7); by Fellows; ? by Bailie; by Waddington; by K&R (R.I.17v, mention); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition in 1973. Published by Boeckh from Sherard papers, CIG 2769; by Fellows, Acct. 325, no. 33, whence CIG p. 1109, ?Bailie, Fasc. ii 36, no. 62; by Waddington, LBW 1608; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 480, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 272.

entry.title: Posthumous honours for Adrastos son of Nikotimos
entry.summary: White marble base without moulding (0.54 × 1.095 × 0.54) chipped above, and damaged at the lower right side. Inscribed on the face. Date: First century A.D. (prosopography). Photo. Recorded by Deering (4v-5, no. 18); by Gaudin (162); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Leake, from Deering, TRSL 1843, 235 and 290-291, no. 6 whence Waddington, LBW 1602a, Liermann 101-102, no. 19; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 113-114, no. 33; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 484, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 222. Published by Smith, Roman Portrait Statuary from Aphrodisias, p.22.

entry.title: Consolatory decree, on death of Apphia daughter of Timotheos
entry.summary: White marble block, complete, but with the surface broken away to left and below (1.56 × 0.51 × 0.60). Inscribed on the face. Date: First to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the MAMA expedition in 1934; by the NYU expedition in 1973. Cormack, from the MAMA records, no. 407, whence L. Robert, Hellenica 13, 229 (ll. 15-17), McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 13.

entry.title: List of names or graffiti
entry.summary: Large white marble block 0.96 × 0.55 × 0.40, chipped along all edges, the surface polished over approximately two thirds of its area, but roughened at the right side. The inscription begins close to the upper edge, and perhaps commenced on an upper block. Date: First to fourth centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (Walls 12). Unpublished.

entry.title: Funerary inscription and honours for Attalos son of Attalos
entry.summary: White marble block chipped along the upper edge and still partly buried (visible 1.13 x 0.38 x 0.62). Inscribed on the face. Date: First century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (Walls 133). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Posthumous honours for Attalos son of Makedon
entry.summary: White marble block with a drafted margin at top and both sides (0.60 × 1.21 × 0.44);. Inscribed on the face. Date: Perhaps second half of the first century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Sherard (10101, f.9) and Picenini (10102, 13v, 71); by Fellows; ?perhaps by Bailie; by Waddington; by Kubitschek and Reichel (Abklatsch 79, no notebook entry); by Gaudin; (100); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard (misrepresenting the line lengths) and Picenini, CIG 2781, ; by Fellows, Acct. 327-328, no. 32 whence CIG II p. 1111, whence Bailie, Fasc. ii 18-19 and 278, no. 47; by Waddington, LBW 1600 mentioned by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 120, no. 43byCormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 479, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 245. Discussed by Reynolds, The first known Aphrodisian to hold a procuratorship, Steine und Wege (Vienna 1999), 327-334, Appendix C, no 2.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Funerary inscription for Liburnos son of Diotrephes
entry.summary: White marble block 0.78 × 0.99 × 0.51 the exposed face was within a moulding which was capped by a moulded gable between acroteria; all mouldings have been carefully chipped away to facilitate re-use. The sides were left rough, and not intended to be seen, but the face is designed like a stele. Inscribed on the main panel on the face. Date: Perhaps late first, early second century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (DM; Walls 158). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Building dedication under Domitian.
entry.summary: White marble monumental block with wide flat mouldings, from which some moulding has been chipped away to facilitate reuse (a: 0.93 × 0.55 × 0.44) broken into five fragments, of which only one has been found again. The mouldings suggest that this could have served as a lintel over a doorway. The text is cut on the broad upper moulding (ll. 1-7) and on a lower moulding (ll. 8-9). Date: A.D. 81/96 titulature. Photo. Recorded by Doublet and Deschamps; copied by Kubitschek (KIII.31, Abklatsch 90, and another fragment, 93); by Gaudin (3); a (upper left corner) recorded by the MAMA expedition and found by the NYU expedition in 1973. Published by Doublet & Deschamps, 7-10 ; by Reinach, from Gaudin, 126; by Cormack, from Kubitschek's notebook, ABSA 44, 1954, pp. 9-10, whence SEG 1964.731; BE 1956.76; by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 449, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 107.

entry.title: Gameboard
entry.summary: Large white marble block. On the upper face. Date: Second-tenth century A.D. (context). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Roueché, Gameboards 17.ii.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Fragmentary honours
entry.summary: White marble fragment from the right end of a statue base without moulding (0.58 x 0.46 x 0.12). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1983 (83.207). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for Lucius Antonius Zosas, who has established a foundation
entry.summary: White marble statue base (0.53 × 1.11 × 0.53). The block is complete, although slightly chipped along the upper edge, and damaged at the lower right side;. Inscribed on the face. The text must have begun on an upper block within a composite monument. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photo. Copied by Doublet and Deschamps; by K&R (unpublished); recorded by Gaudin (82); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition (the lower part buried). Published Doublet & Deschamps, BCH 14, 1890, 610-611, no. 6, whence Ziebarth, ZVRW 16, 1903, 292, no. 62, Laum no. 113; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 128, no. 55; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 524, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 236.

entry.title: Building inscription: restoration of building by ?Eusebes
entry.summary: Two adjoining pieces making up a block from a white marble entablature (together 1.55 × 0.41 × 0.50). Inscribed on two of the three fasciae. Date: Second century A.D. (lettering). Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1975 (Walls 107). Unpublished.

entry.title: Decree of honours for Praxiteles son of Aristeas
entry.summary: White marble block (0.68 × 0.74 × 0.48) complete on all sides, although upper left corner is lost, and left side is chipped; unfinished at back. Inscribed on the face. Date: Perhaps early second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by K&R (KIII.56, Abklatsch 39); recorded by Gaudin (43); recorded by the MAMA expedition; found by the NYU expedition (catalogue number 76.185). Published by Kubitschek & Reichel, AAWW no. 7, whence Buresch, RhM 49, 1894, 431; published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, no. 7, whence Abbott & Johnson no. 137, Robert, Et. Anat. 101; published by Cormack from the MAMA records as MAMA 414, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 14 .

entry.title: Funerary text for ?Soteira
entry.summary: White marble block (1.04 x 0.76 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second century A.D. (stephanephoros, lettering). Photo. Copied by Kubitschek (K III 29, Abklatsch in Box 1); recorded by Gaudin (2); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 280-281, no. 175; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 556b whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 532.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Theseus
entry.summary: White marble fragment probably from the upper left corner of a panel or sarcophagus front ( 0.74 x 0.19 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the exposed face. Date: ?Second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Kubitschek (III, 59); by Gaudin (121); by the NYU expedition in 1975. Published by Reinach from Gaudin, REG 19, 1906, 271-272, no. 166, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 537 .

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Neikomachos and others
entry.summary: Right side of a white marble block damaged also at the upper and lower right corners (1.02 x 0.64 x 0.31). Inscribed on the exposed face within a moulded panel with narrow rebates along the right and lower edges. The upper edge is plain, and the opening of the text was presumably cut on the block which adjoined it above. Date: Later second to early third century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition in 1989, and again in 1995, when more was exposed. Published by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 546, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 513.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for Claudia Antonia Tatiane
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft (0.87 x 0.38 x 0.08). Inscribed on the face. Date: Late second to third centuries A.D. but (cf. 12.1004) probably before 212 (nomenclature). Copied by Wood (14, f45v); by Deering (f.6, no. 24bis); by Fellows; by Loew; by Bailie (Researches 47-8); by Falkener; by Waddington in 1850; by Kubitschek (K.III 29a). Not reported subsequently. Published by Leake, from Deering, 10; by Fellows, no. 38, whence CIG 2819b; by Bailie 58; noted by Franz, from Loew, a.4; noted, with no modifications, by Henzen, from Falkener, 4; by Waddington, LBW 1597, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 289 .

entry.title: Honours for T. Cl. Kapitoleinos
entry.summary: 'A pedestal' (Fellows); presumably a statue base shaft, probably broken below. Inscribed on the face. Date: Third century A.D. (nomenclature). Photo. Transcribed by Sherard in 1716 (BM.Add. 10101. f.120); by Fellows in 1840 and by Waddington in 1850. Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh from Sherard, CIG 2797; by Fellows, no. 29; from both of these by Bailie, no. 57; published by Waddington, LBW 1598, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 294 .

entry.title: Posthumous honours for M. Fl. Antonius Lysimachos
entry.summary: Upper part of a white marble base without moulding (0.48 × 0.42 × 0.38). Inscribed on the face. The upper edge is complete; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Date: II-III, ?after 181 (contests). Photo. Copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102 18 and, from Tisser, 53v) whence Sherard (1010, 16) and in 1716 by Sherard (10101, 121); copied by Deering (f. 2v, no. 9); recorded by Gaudin (163); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard, CIG 2785, whence Liermann 116-117, no. 20b; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 134, no. 64; published by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 501, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 318; published by Roueché, PPA 54.

entry.title: Honours for emperor Caracalla
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft, without moulding (0.57 × 1.14 × 0.56). The stone is complete; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Inscribed on the face. Date: A.D. 198-210 (Caracalla's reign). Photo. Copied by Deering (f.3v, no. 14); copied by Waddington; recorded by K&R (squeeze); recorded by Gaudin (44); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Leake, from Deering, no. 4; by Waddington, LBW 1623; by Reinach, from Gaudin, no. 21; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 451, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 208.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for M. Aurelius Demetrios
entry.summary: No description. No description. Date: Third to fourth centuries A.D. (terminology). Copied by Deering (2, no. 5); recorded by K&R (squeeze); recorded by Gaudin (41); not reported subsequently. Published by Leake, from Deering, TRSL 1843, 234 and 288, no. 2, whence Waddington LBW 1643a; by Reinach from Gaudin, REG 19, 1906, 265-266, no. 160, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 447 .

entry.title: Warning against throwing earth
entry.summary: A white marble masonry block, broken to the right (1.15 × 0.95 × 0.30), with holes for clamps below the upper edge. If, as seems likely, the large cross was central to the block, the original width of the block was 2m, and it extended to the corner of the bastion. Disposed on either side of a large inscribed cross (H. 0.85, original W. 0.50). Date: Fifth century or later (lettering, content). Photo. Copied by Paris and Holleaux; recorded by Gaudin (10); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published Paris and Holleaux, , no. 13, whence Ramsay, CBP 555, no. 429; by Reinach, no. 18, from Gaudin, whence IGC 248, DACL 1, col. 193, vol. 14, col. 796, no. 23; by Cormack MAMA 8, no. 428 and plate, from the MAMA records, ; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 112 and plate xxix, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 762.

entry.title: Invocations
entry.summary: Interior masonry blocks of a small gateway. i: 0.39 × 0.98, D. not measurable; ii: 0.54 × 0.34 × 1.03. Text i is cut on a block at the entrance to the passage, on the north side; ii is cut on the facing block on the south side. Both inscriptions are disposed around a shallowly-cut cross. Date: Fifth-sixth century or later (content). Photos. Recorded by Gaudin (118, 119); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, no.s. 214, 215, from Gaudin, whence Grégoire, IGC 265, 266; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 458, ; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity, no. 139 and plates xxxiii, xxxiv.

entry.title: Restoration of the honours for his ancestor by Kallikrates
entry.summary: Plain white marble statue base shaft (0.74 x 1.005 x 0.34). inscribed on the exposed face. Date: iFirst century B.C.; ii First century A.D.( lettering, prosopography). Photos. Lines 1-13 copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102, 28v and 64v) whence Sherard (10101, 38). Copied by Deering (no. 7); Complete text copied by Waddington; recorded by Gaudin (47); recorded by the MAMA expedition in 1934. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1977. Published by Boeckh from Sherard, CIG 2796 and p. 1112; published by Waddington, LBW 1601b whence Liermann 17-19, no. 3; published by Reinach, from Gaudin, 79, whence L. Robert, Ét.Anat. 313 n.2. Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 406whence Lane, Berytus 15, 1964, 27, no. 1; Lane, Corpus Mon. Dei Menis I no. 118. Mentioned by Reynolds, PCPS 206, 1980, p.72, whence SEG 1980.1245; Published by Reynolds, Aphrodisias & Rome, doc. 29, whence SEG 1982.1097, BullEp 1983.387, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 24 .

entry.title: Funerary honours by Artemeis for her brother Bacchios
entry.summary: A plain white marble block (0.67 × 0.995 × 0.535) probably a building block rather than a statue base. Inscribed on the face, within an area that has been smoothed; the whole stone apparently weathered. Date: First century B.C. to first century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Copied in 1705 by Picenini, (10102, 34, and, from Tisser, 67) whence Sherard (10101, 46); by Deering (1v, no. 6); by Waddington; by Gaudin (42); by the MAMA expedition; and by the NYU expedition in 1973. Published from Sherard by Boeckh, CIG 2806; by Waddington, LBW 1616; from Gaudin's squeeze by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 120-121, no. 46; from the MAMA records by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 463, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 262.

entry.title: Building dedications, by Antipatros and by Dionysios, to Demos
entry.summary: Two complete white marble blocks, which do not join, from the plain architrave blocks, with a simple moulding above two fasciae. i: 2.66 × 0.36 × 0.36; ii: 2.03 × 0.36 x depth not measurable. Inscribed in one line on each fascia. Date: Perhaps first century B.C. to first century A.D. (lettering). Photos. i recorded by K&R (K III.55, Abklatsch 62); i and ii recorded by Gaudin (49 and 50);both found again by the NYU expedition. i published by Kubitschek and Reichel, no. 4; i and ii published, from Gaudin, by Reinach, 127 and 128, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 124, 126.

entry.title: Building dedication to Demos
entry.summary: Architrave block. No description. No description. Date: Late first century B.C. (lettering). Copied; in 1705 by Picenini (10102, 15v) and Sherard (10101.12). Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh from Sherard papers, CIG 2752. Cormack takes 12.506 (=MAMA 440) to be a fragment.

entry.title: Building dedication to Demos
entry.summary: White marble architrave block (2.66 × 0.365) with moulding above chipped away for re-use. Inscribed on one fascia. Date: Late first century B.C. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (13); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 131; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8. 442, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 118.

Recorded by Gaudin (12); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin, 130i; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8. 443, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 119.

entry.title: Building dedication to Demos
entry.summary: White marble architrave block with moulding above chipped away for re-use (0.258 [[check]] x 0.365). Inscribed on one fascia. Date: Late first century B.C. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (12); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin, 130ii; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8. 444, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 120.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Flavia Apphia
entry.summary: Plain white marble block, cut away at the top and at the left side; the right end is covered by a block of the city wall at right angles to this short stretch. There is a clamphole with a channel leading up to the lower edge in the left corner sector. (0.46 × 0.63 × depth not measurable). Inscribed on the visible face. Date: First to second century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition (Walls 151). Published by Reynolds, The first known Aphrodisian to hold a procuratorship, Steine und Wege (Vienna 1999), 327-334, B.4, whence SEG 49 1999.1420 .

entry.title: Honours for Mithridates son of Athenagoras
entry.summary: White marble building block (0.34 × 0.47 × 0.34) without moulding, but with a recessed edge on all sides. The inscription is cut on the face, some way down the stone, and runs into the frame on both sides. Date: First century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Found during the clearing of the East Gate in 1904 and recorded by Gaudin (108), 'la face engagée dans la maçonnerie'; by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published from Gaudin's squeeze by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 135, no 66; from the MAMA records by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 462, whence Robert, BCH 107, 1983, 505-506, and McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 510; by published by Reynolds, 'The first known Aphrodisian to hold a procuratorship', Steine und Wege (Vienna, 1999), 327-334, Appendix B.5., cited SEG 49 1999.1417.

entry.summary: White marble block (2.45 x 0.65 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: First to second century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (123); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 266-267, no. 161; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 548, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 411.

entry.title: Honours for anonymous, having held every office in the city
entry.summary: A white marble statue base without mouldings. Inscribed on the face. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. The full text copied by Sherard in 1716 ' on the east side' (10101, 130) and by Picenini in 1705 (10102, 33v and, from Tisser, 56v, whence 10101, 44-5). Three fragments found by the NYU expedition: 72.488 (lines 8-15), 74.256 two joining fragments (ll. 16-23 and 24-27). Published from Sherard's 1716 copy by Boeckh, CIG 2789, whence Liermann 45-47, no. 7, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 299.

Recorded by Gaudin (16); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Date: Second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Gaudin (120); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published, from Gaudin, by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 227, no. 135; by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 598, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 520.

entry.title: Honours for Apollonios the high-priest
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft (0.56 × 1.18 × 0.48) with moulded panels on all four sides. Inscribed on the front panel. l. 1 is cut on the upper moulding. The text must have begun on an upper feature, now lost. Date: Late second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photo. Recorded by K&R (KIII.32) who did not see l. 1; by Gaudin (15); by the NYU expedition in 1976 (76.184; SBI 30). Published by K&R, Anz Akad Wien, no. 9; from Gaudin's squeeze by Reinach, 77, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 338; cited from Reinach by Oikonomos, Arch Delt 1921/22, 294.

Recorded by Picenini (no. 57: BM Add. 10102, 7, 26, and, from Tisser, 54); by Wood (14, f45v); by Kubitschek (III.61; Abklatsch 29); by Gaudin (146); by the MAMA expedition; and by the NYU expedition in 1975. entry.title: Building dedication to Demos
entry.summary: White marble architrave block, complete (2.53 × 0.42 × depth not measurable) with a very simple single moulding above. Inscribed on the face. The spacing of the text suggest that the block is from a composite monument. Date: Late first century B.C. (lettering). Photos. Copied in 1705 by Sherard (10101, 12) and by Picenini (10102, 15 and, from Tisser, 74); copied by Wood (14, f.45); copied by Deering (12v, no. 41); copied by Fellows; copied by Waddington; noted by Reichel (I, 24v); recorded by Gaudin (138); recorded by the MAMA expedition; recorded by the NYU expedition (MB). Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, 2751; published by Fellows, 15, whence Bailie 70; published by Waddington, LBW 1590; published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 129; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, 439, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 84.

Cormack thought this likely to be a fragment of 12.405 (=CIG 2752).

entry.summary: White marble block, complete, without moulding (0.67 × 0.42 × 0.70). Inscribed at far left side of block; the text, at least of line 6, must have continued onto an adjacent block. Inscribed on the face. Date: A.D. 41/54 (reign). Photos. Copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102, 28), whence Sherard (10101,39); by Wood (14, f.45); by Deering (2v, no.12); by Loew; by Waddington; by Gaudin (78); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition in 1977. Add. 10102 34r), whence Sherard (BL. Add. 10101 46r); ?by Bailie; by Loew; by Waddington; recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Bailie, Fasciculus, no. 73, cf. There was already a faulty area on the face which the cutter avoided. Date: Probably early second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (DM; Walls 160). Unpublished.

entry.title: Honours for Tiberius Claudius Attalos
entry.summary: White marble statue base without moulding (0.575 × 1.325 × 0.51) which is damaged at the upper left corner and along the top edge. Inscribed on one face. The text will have begun on an upper feature. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering and prosopography). Photo. Recorded by Wood (14, p. 46); by Deering (f. 5v, no. 23); by Fellows; by Loew; by Bailie, (Researches 43-4); by Waddington; by K&R (RI.17v, mention); by Gaudin; by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Fellows, Acct. 327-328, no. 37, whence CIG 2781b (p. 1111); from Deering by Leake, TRSL 1843, 236 and 292 no. 9; from his own copy by Bailie, 59; mentioned, from Loew, by Franz, a.3; by Waddington, LBW 1596; mentioned, from Gaudin's squeeze, by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 120, no. 44; from the MAMA records, by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 502 whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 293.

entry.title: Honours for Zenas descendent of Apollonios
entry.summary: White marble statue base without moulding; surviving fragment only (0.38 × 0.36 × 0.22). Inscribed on one face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering); perhaps third century in view of the wife's nomen. The complete text was copied by Sherard in 1705 (10101, 42) and by Wood (14, f47); fragment b (opening letters of lines 11-20) was copied in Karaçasu by Fellows in 1840; in 1934 only one fragment (left side of lines 1-8) was recorded by the MAMA expedition. No fragments found subsequently. It is probable that the text copied by Sherard and Wood was on a complete block; Wood comments 'beginning lost', but this is likely to refer to the text which, as in many other instances, may well have begun on a crowning feature. Published by Boeckh from Sherard, CIG 2768; the Karaçasu fragment published by Fellows, Acct. 300, no. 12, whence CIG p. 1119; the fragments discussed by Cormack, Notes 4, 9-10, and 55 fig. 1; the whole text published from the CIG and MAMA records, by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 520, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 332.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Aurelius Eumachos Apellas
entry.summary: White marble block (1.625 x 1.11 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102.26v, and, from Tisser, 76) and by Sherard (10101, 15v); by Deering (7v, no 31); by Fellows; by Bailie: see Researches, 53-63, with a description of how he had the stone cleared, (under the influence of a noon-day sun in the month of August); by Waddington; by Loew; by Reichel (RI.31-31v, Abklatsch 54); recorded by Gaudin (139); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard, CIG 2834; by Fellows, Acct. 336-339, no. 44, whence p. 1116, by Bailie, Fasc. ii 45-47 and 307-315, no. 74. Mentioned by Franz, from Loew, a.15. Published by Waddington, LBW 1632; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 267, no. 162; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 559, whence Hellenica 13, 211 (l. 16);, BE 1966:406, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 448.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Zenon son of Zenon ... son of Kallias
entry.summary: White marble block (1.51 x 0.74 x depth not measurable). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Gaudin (77); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 272-274, no. 168; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 556a, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 542.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Aurelius Hermes and family, establishing a foundation
entry.summary: White marble block; remaining fragment 0.40 x 0.65 x 0.26 (MAMA). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photo. Copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102, 22-22v and, from Tisser, 66v-67), whence Sherard (10101, 34-35); a copy obtained by Raoul-Rochette. Copied by Deering (13v-14, no. 44). Fragment recorded by the MAMA expedition; not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard and Raoul-Rochette's papers, CIG 2826, whence Laum, no. 107, discussion by Cormack, Notes 15 and 61 fig. 9; published by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 577, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 528.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Zoilos son of Apollonios
entry.summary: A panel blackened and worn by weathering (H. 0.77, W. 0.98, D 0.25) figuring a gable in flat relief with a tabella ansata outlined in similar relief below it. Inscribed on the relief of the gable (l.1) within the gable (ll. 2-3) on the upper moulding of the tabella (ll. 4-5) and within the tabella (ll.6 ff.) The surface is very badly worn. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Kubitschek (K III.34, Abklatsch 71); by the NYU expedition. Published from K's notebookby Cormack, no. 15, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 540 . highlighted letters seen by K&R but not by us.

entry.title: Honours for Molossos, a child
entry.summary: No description; presumably a statue base. No description. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. Copied by Picenini in 1705 (10102, 23, 75), and by Sherard, in 1705 and 1716 (10101, 14 and 120); by Wood in 1750 (14, f.45); by Deering, no. 17. Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh from Sherard papers, CIG 2770, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 307 .

entry.title: Fragmentary honours for ?Chaireas
entry.summary: No description; probably a statue base. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (prosopography). Copied by Sherard(10101, 37) and Picenini (10102, 24v and, from Tisser, 64) in 1705. Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh from Sherard papers CIG 2798, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 264 .

entry.title: Honours for Diogenes and Attalos
entry.summary: Sherard described these texts as on two funerary altars; Boeckh thought this unlikely. 'Upon a pedestal' Fellows, so probably statue bases. Inscribed on the face. Sherard's description may imply that there was an upper moulding, in which case the texts are probably complete. Date: Second century A.D. (prosopography). Two blocks, both copied by Picenini (BM Add. 10102, 28v) in 1705 whence Sherard (10101, 12v) and by Sherard in 1716 (10101, 120); i copied by Deering (p.5, no. 19); i and ii copied by Fellows; i by Loew; i and ii ?by Bailie; by Waddington. Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, CIG 2805 a & b; i by Fellows no. 39; both by Bailie 64 and 65; i noted by Franz, from Loew, a.11; i and ii by Waddington, LBW 1615, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 269 (i), 244 (ii).

entry.title: Honours for Aurelia Messouleia Satorneila
entry.summary: No description; probably a statue base. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (nomenclature). Copied by Sherard (10101, 14) and Picenini (10102, 25, and from Tisser, 56, and 75v) in 1705; Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, CIG 2821, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 248 .

entry.title: Honours for Aurelia Flavia Messouleia
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft, with moulding. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photo. Copied by Sherard (10101, 44) and Picenini (10102, 32v, 54v) in 1705; by Wood in 1750 (vol. 14, 45). A fragment, from the left upper corner and edge, with lines 1-6, found by the NYU expedition in the Museum (Museum 27). Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, CIG 2822, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 249.

entry.title: Honours for Aelia Laevilla
entry.summary: No description; presumably a statue base. No description. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (nomenclature, titulature). Copied by Sherard in 1705 (10101, 16). Not reported subsequently. , Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, CIG 2823, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 225 .

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for M. Aurelius Ariston; establishment of a foundation by Aurelia Ammia
entry.summary: i: Lines 1-2 are on a large statue base capital (0.55 plus moulding 0.24 x 0.43 x 0.625 with the upper moulding broken away, and broken below. ii: Lines 3 ff are 'on a square marble, with moulding, on ye ground' (Sherard); a white marble statue base, at least 1 m. high, of which three fragments survive. a: ll.1-4; upper edge remains, with moulding, very chipped (0.10 × 0.22 × 0.30). b: ll.13-20; no edges (0.105 × 0.255 × 0.19). c: ll.20-26; no edges (0.10 × 0.28 × 0.15). i. inscribed in two lines along the lower fascia. The text must have begun on a fascia of the upper moulding. ii. inscribed on one face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photos. ii was copied, complete, by Sherard (BM Add. 10101, 14) and Picenini (10102, 25v, and, from Tisser, 75v) in 1705. Fragment b recorded by Kubitschek and Reichel in 1893 (no notebook record); recorded by the MAMA expedition (see Cormack, Notes 10 and 56, and MAMA 8. 491). a, b and c recorded by the NYU expedition (no number, 69.318 and 69.323). i was first recorded by the NYU expedition. Lines 3 ff. published by Boeckh from Sherard papers, CIG 2774, whence Liermann, Analecta, 53, IX, Ziebarch, Zeitschift fergl. Rechtswissenschaft 16 (1903), 291-2, nos. 60 and 63, Laum, Stiftungen 104, and by Cormack, MAMA 491 and Notes on the Inscribed Monuments 10, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 340.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for Publius Aelius Hilarianos from his mother
entry.summary: Shaft of a white marble statue base; surviving fragment (0.30 × 0.24 × 0.13). Inscribed within a moulded front panel. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, content). Photos. The complete block was copied in 1705 by Picenini (10102 28v and, from Tisser, 55), whence Sherard (10101.44); by Wood in 1750 (vol. 14 f. 45v); by Deering (5v, no.25); by Fellows; by Loew in 1841; by Bailie; by Le Bas in 1843 and by Waddington in 1851. A fragment of the upper part of the stone, with part of the first three lines, was recorded by the NYU expedition (71.45). Published by Boeckh from Sherard and Picenini, CIG 2793; by Fellows, no. 40, whence CIG p. 1112; Bailie, no. 63; a correction published by Franz from Loew, a.5; published by Waddington, from Le Bas, no 595, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 230; discussed by W. Eck, ZPE 42 (1981), 235-6, whence SEG 1981.902, BE 1981.517.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for C. Julius Philippos,
entry.summary: 'Base' (Waddington); if this is complete, it must be a statue base shaft; the text must have begun on an upper feature. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (terminology). Photo. Transcribed in 1705 by Sherard (10101.38) and Picenini (10102.28 and, from Tisser, 64v); by Waddington in 1850; not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard and Picenini, CIG 2790; by Waddington, LBW 1609, whence OGIS 500, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 282 .

entry.title: Posthumous honours for anonymous, son of Tryphon
entry.summary: 'on white marble square with mouldings near 2 feet wide and 3 1/2 high, on the ground' (Sherard). (probably a statue base). No description. Date: Late second or early third century A.D. (nomenclature, paternal nomen). Copied by Sherard (10101, 14) and Picenini (10102, 25 and 75v) in 1705,. Not reported subsequently. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard papers, CIG 2794, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 546 .

entry.title: Letter of M. Ulpius Appuleius Eurykles to the Aphrodisians
entry.summary: No description. No description. Date: Between 180 and 189, probably early 180s (Prosopography). Copied by Picenini in 1705 (BM Add. 10102, 23-23v) whence Sherard (BM Add. 10101 35-6); by Wood in 1750 (14, f45); not reported subsequently. Published from Sherard by Boeckh, CIG 2741, whence Liermann, Analecta 20, OGIS 509, B. Laum, Stiftungen in der griechischen und römischen Antike (Leipzig/Berlin, 1914), 103 (ll. 13-23), Pickard-Cambridge, Festivals 2, 320, no.16a. Republished from Sherard's notebook by J. M. Reynolds, A&R 57, whence SEG 32, 1982.1097; BE 1983.392. PHI 69Roueché, PPA 50.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for M. Aur. Cl. Ktesias
entry.summary: White marble base capital with heavy moulding above (top 0.68 × 0.70; shaft 0.42 × 0.37; height 0.32), broken away to right. Inscribed on the upper moulding (l.1) on lower fascia (l.2) and on the shaft (l.3 ff). The text very probably continued on a base below. Date: Probably third century (lettering, nomenclature). Photos. Recorded by Gaudin; by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 132, no. 61, whence (on line 4) Robert, RPh 3, 1929, 126, no. 5, SEG 4, 399; by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 503, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 258.

entry.title: Dedicator's prayer
entry.summary: An Ionic column capital, lying half buried. No measurements. Inscribed on two consecutive faces of the upper moulding (abacus). Date: Early or middle Byzantine. Copied by Bailie (see Transactions of the Royal Irish Academy 21, 26 June 1843, 50); not reported subsequently. Published by Bailie, no. 72e, whence LBW 1649, IGC 251, Ramsay, CBP 554, no. 423, DACL col. 795, no. 17, Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 109, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 640.

entry.title: Cross-monograms
entry.summary: Two adjacent white marble masonry blocks. On the face, ii to the east of i; to the west of these are three carefully cut crosses. Date: Sixth century or later (monogram). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 210, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 703, 683.

entry.title: Fragment (Hellenistic)
entry.summary: Fragment from the right side of a white marble stele (0.19 × 0.40 × 0.25). Inscribed on one face whose surface is unpolished. Date: Late Hellenistic (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (75.14). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Funerary honours for Geis and Heraios
entry.summary: White marble architrave block (1.22 × 0.42 × depth not measurable), with upper moulding chipped away. Inscribed on a single fasci, i. to the left of ii. The block appeara complete to the left; i. must have begun on an adjoining block. Date: First century B.C. - first century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by Sherard (10101, 12v) and Picenini (10102, 18v) in 1705; by Fellows; by Loew; by Kubitschek (KIII.45) noted by Reichael (R I, 24v); recorded by Gaudin (19); by the MAMA expedition; and by the NYU expedition in 1973. Published from Sherard and Picenini by Boeckh, CIG 2809; by Fellows, Acct. 326-327, no. 36, whence CIG II pp. 1112 and 1115; by Franz, from Loew, Ann. d. Inst. 19, 1847, 110-111, no. a.18; from Gaudin's squeeze by Reinach, REG 19, 1906, 121, no. 47; from the MAMA records by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 465 whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 277.

entry.summary: Fragment from the top of a white marble moulding (0.075 × 0.08 × 0.05). Inscribed on the face. Date: Possibly first century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (75.51). Unpublished.

entry.summary: Fragment from the top of a white marble statue base (0.12 × 0.37 × 0.20); a simple upper moulding survives, but no other edges. Inscribed on the face below moulding. Date: First to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1976 (76.98). Unpublished.

entry.title: Fragment from Walls
entry.summary: Fragment ? from a white marble sarcophagus front, without edges (0.38 × 0.24 × 0.18); above, part of a draped figure; below, a panel defined by an upper moulding and a pilaster to the left. Inscribed within panel. Date: First to fourth centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1977 (77.99). Unpublished.

entry.summary: Fragment from a sarcophagus front, moulded above (0.32 × 0.145 × 0.18). Inscribed on the face. Date: First to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1977 (77.122). Unpublished.

entry.title: Posthumous honours for Apphia daughter of Theodoros
entry.summary: White marble block (0.78 × 0.54 × 0.49) broken below. Inscribed on the face. Date: First century A.D. Recorded by Kubitschek (KIII.62, Abklatsch 52); by Gaudin (137); by the MAMA expedition; not reported subsequently. Published from Gaudin's squeeze and K&R byReinach, REG 19, 1906, 116-117, no. 38; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 478 , whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 237. Published by Reynolds, 'The first known Aphrodisian to hold a procuratorship', Steine und Wege (Vienna, 1999), 327-334, nos. C, 2.

entry.title: Funerary for son of Menodotos son of Neikoteimos
entry.summary: Piece from a moulded panel or sarcophagus front (0.81 × 0.59 × 0.14) with a right edge, but perhaps cut down. Inscribed on the moulding. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1976 (76.131). Unpublished.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Flavius
entry.summary: A: Two joining white marble pieces forming the left hand block of a composite monument (together 1.13 x 0.71 x 0.32) with a hole on top for an attachment. B: Right hand block 1.56 × 0.72 × 0.36 with badly chipped surface to left. Inscribed on the face. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Copied by Fellows; by Loew; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Fellows, no. 57, p. 356, whence CIG 2850d; seen by Loew, whence noted Franz a.17, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 526 .

entry.title: Decree of honours for Dionysios son of Papylos
entry.summary: White marble block (1.29 × 0.68 × 0.28) apparently complete on all sides. Inscribed on the face; presumably continued on a lower block. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (lettering, prosopography). Photo. Recorded by Gaudin (80); recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, 8, whence discussed A. Wilhelm, Beiträge 315; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 410, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 33 .

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for Tiberius Claudius Hierokles
entry.summary: A white marble base, with moulding above and below (0.69 x 0.34 x depth not measurable) from a composite monument, of which it formed the right side. Inscribed on the exposed face, i. to the left of ii. Date: Second half of first century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1975 (Walls 111). Unpublished.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Honours for Titus Caesar
entry.summary: Plain white marble statue base shaft broken below and chipped at the upper left corner (0.72 × 1.16 × 0.52). Inscribed on the face. Two large squre cuttings on top. Date: A.D. 69-79 (reign). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.334; SBI 51). Mentioned by Reynolds, ZPE 43, 1981, 320, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 939.

entry.rights: Creative Commons licence Attribution 2.5 (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.5/). All reuse or distribution of this work must contain somewhere a link back to the URL http://insaph.kcl.ac.uk/.
entry.title: Gladiator memorial for Skirtos
entry.summary: A white marble altar-stele, with moulding above and below on three sides (0.90 × 0.40 × 0.38. The relief is of a gladiator, a retiarius, wearing only a loin-guard, and a strap over his left shoulder, advancing to his left; he has a bare head and hair down to his shoulders. In his left hand he holds a tall trident, whose head is lost; in his right hand he holds a short sword. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, content). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1976 (76.20). Published Erim, Türk Arkeoloji Dergisi 25 (1980), 21, whence SEG 30 1980.1257, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 531 ; by Roueché, PPA 31.

entry.title: Fragment (II cent)
entry.summary: Fragment of marble (0.95 × 0.145 × 0.09). Inscribed on one face. Date: Probably second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (75.36). Unpublished.

entry.title: Fragment (II cent)
entry.summary: Two joining fragments from the top of a marble base or panel (0.12 × 0.06 × 0.055). Inscribed on one face. Date: Probably second century A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition (75.50). Unpublished.

entry.title: Fragment, second to third century, from South Wall
entry.summary: Lower right corner of base or base capital, tapering from a broader base (0.10 × 0.21 × 0.08). Inscribed on upper, narrower area. Date: Perhaps second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (75.337). Unpublished.

entry.title: Fragment, second century, from SW Walls
entry.summary: Fragment of moulding. Inscribed in a reserved space (0.16 × 0.05). Date: Probably second century A.D. (lettering; cutting). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (76.50). Unpublished.

entry.title: Fragment of base capital, second/third century
entry.summary: Lower left corner of a moulded piece, probably a base capital (0.115 × 0.072 × 0.111). Inscribed on the upper, outset moulding. Date: Probably second to third centuries A.D. (lettering; cutting). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (76.114). Unpublished.

entry.title: Gladiator memorial for Fortis
entry.summary: A white marble altar-stele with moulding above and below on three sides (0.89 x 0.41 x 0.385).; The relief is of a gladiator, a retiarius, inclined to his left. His right arm is bent and his hand rests on his right hip, with the net hanging over it. In his left hand he holds upright his trident, with two prongs, and a small square object resting on it. Inscribed on face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (content, lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1975 (excavation inventory 75.90). Published by Roueché, PPA 29.

entry.title: Gladiator memorial for Aniketos
entry.summary: A white marble altar-stele with moulding above and below on three sides (0.90 x 0.40 x 0.38). The relief is of a gladiator advancing to his left. He wears body armour and a helmet which covers his face. On his left arm he holds a long shield in front of his body; in his right hand he holds a short sword. Inscribed on face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (content, lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.280). Published by Roueché, PPA 30.

entry.title: Honours for M. Valerius Epaphrodeitos, singer to the kithara
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft without moulding (1.24 x 0.63-0.61 x 0.65). Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (terminology, lettering). Photos. Copied by William Sherard in 1705 (BM MS Add. 10101 f. 37); by Kubitschek (KIII, 1), on which see J. M. R. Cormack, The Inscribed Monuments of Aphrodisias, 13; by the NYU expedition in 1976. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard, CIG 2813, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias; by Roueché, PPA 68.

entry.title: Funerary relief for anonymous, emporiarch
entry.summary: White marble relief stele of irregular shape (a rectangle without its lower left corner) chipped along all adges and sporadically over the face (0.29 × 0.40 × 0.06). The upper part carries a male portrait bust in high relief, the head almost in the round as it rises above the upper edge of the stele. See further Smith. loc. cit. Inscribed on either side of the head (ll. 1-5) and below the bust (ll. 6-7). The first two lines to the left of the head have been erased. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.22). Published by Reynolds, The Linen-market of Aphrodisias in Caria in Arculiana, H. Bögli Festschrift, 523-8; by Smith, Roman Portrait Statuary from Aphrodisias, Relief 2.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Eutychos
entry.summary: Rough white marble block with chipped upper edge (0.44 × 0.41 × 0.23); a rough raised edge surrounds the bust of a young man in relief. See further Smith, loc. cit. Inscribed below bust. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (sculpture). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1976 (76.182). Published by Smith, Roman Portrait Statuary from Aphrodisias, Relief 4.

entry.title: Funerary inscription for Aurelia Papiane and family
entry.summary: Two white marble blocks, of which the right is lost. The left hand block is complete above, below and to the left 1.30 × 0.93 × 0.32; damaged in the upper left coner, and along its right side.Masonry block. Inscribed on the face. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering, nomenclature). Photos. Both blocks copied in 1705 by Sherard (10101, 13v) and Picenini (10102, 24, and, from Tisser, 75 v); by Deering (11v-12, no. 38); by Fellows; ? perhaps by Bailie; by Loew; by Waddington. Left side fragment only recorded by Reichel (R.I.25v, mention); recorded by Gaudin (136); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. Published by Boeckh, from Sherard, CIG 2840; by Fellows, Acct. 340-343, no.'s 45, 46, whence CIG p. 1117, Bailie, Fasc. ii 47-49 and 315-317, no. 75; mentioned by Franz, from Loew, a.16; by Waddington, LBW 1637; mentioned by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, REG 19, 1906, 285, no. 181; published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 560, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 440.

entry.title: Funerary fragment
entry.summary: Large white marble crowning block moulded on three sides 1.59 × 0.29 × 1.06. Inscribed on the front moulding; the text must have continued on the face of the monument which this feature crowned. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1976 (Walls 147). Unpublished.

Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1976 (Walls 148). Unpublished.

entry.summary: Round-headed stele (0.36 × 0.59 × 0.32) containing the bust of a boy (face damaged). Inscribed below the bust (inscribed area 0.355 × 0.75). Date: Late second century or third century A.D. (sculpture, lettering). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.284). Published by Smith, Roman Portrait Statuary from Aphrodisias, Relief 3.

entry.summary: Statue base of tapering white marble statue base shaft, damaged above but substantially reconstructed from fragments (0.465–0.425 × 1.17 × 0.44). Inscribed on one face. Date: Probably third century A.D. (lettering; nomenclature). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (76.96, SBI 28). Published in Erim-Reynolds, 'Sculptors' no.19, whence SEG 40 1990.942.

entry.summary: Piece from the top of a white marble moulded feature, probably a sarcophagus lid (0.46 × 0.13 × 0.235). Inscribed on the face, on the fascia and the torus. Date: Third century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.257). Unpublished.

entry.summary: A plain white marble statue base shaft (0.54 × 1.28 × 0.50). Inscribed on the face. Date: A.D. 211-217 Reign. Photos. Recorded (lines 1-10 only) by the MAMA expedition in 1934. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (catalogue no. 75.325; SBI 34). Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, 452, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 209.

entry.title: Honours for a son of Gallienus
entry.summary: Two adjoining fragments of a white marble statue base shaft, without moulding (together 0.46 × 1.08 × 0.42). The upper left corner survives as a separate fragment. Inscribed on the face; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Date: A.D. 256-260 (content). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1976 (a, 76.54; b, unnumbered). Published by Roueché (1981), 2, whence SEG 1981.907, An.Ép. 1981.766; republished by Roueché in Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 3, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 212.

entry.title: Honours for M. Aurelius Diogenes
entry.summary: Two adjoining fragments of a white marble statue base shaft, complete above (0.45 × 1.10 × 0.45). Inscribed on one face; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Date: A.D. 253-260 (content). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.330; SBI 38a & 38b). Published by Roueché, (1981), 4, whence SEG 1981.908, BE 1982.357, An.Ép. 1981.768; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 5. whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 254.

entry.summary: A white marble Statue base shaft, complete on all sides (0.51 × 1.16 × 0.46). Inscribed on the face; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Date: A.D. 253-260 (content). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition in 1975 (75.327; SBI 36). Published by Roueché (1981), 5, whence SEG 1981.909; BE 1982.357; An.Ép. 1981.769; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 6, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 255.

entry.title: Honours for Sallustius family
entry.summary: Two fragments from the left (column i and the opening of column ii) and right (end of column ii, and column iii) of a white marble statue base shaft (0.80 and 0.86 × 1.16 × 0.54) without moulding, but with a small bevel along lower edge. Inscribed in three columns on the face. Date: Second century A.D. (lettering, prosopography). Photos. Recorded by the MAMA expedition; excavated by the NYU expedition (75.333; SBI 52). Published by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 517, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 323, 324, 320; published by Reynolds, 'The first known Aphrodisian to hold a procuratorship', Steine und Wege (Vienna, 1999), 327-334, Appendix A, whence SEG 491999.1417.

entry.title: Honours for an anonymous benefactor
entry.summary: White marble block (0.68 x 0.84 x 0.28); there are three holes in the top for an attachment. Part of a composite monument. inscribed on one face which is damaged along all edges. The text began on an upper block, and continued on a lower one or on one adjacent to the right. Date: Late Republican (lettering, content). Photos. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1977 (77. 137). Published by Reynolds, Aphrodisias & Rome, doc. 30, whence SEG 1982.1097, BE 1983.387, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 26.

entry.summary: White marble masonry block, with moulding below (0.40 × 0.16 × 0.20). Inscribed on the face. Date: I B.C. - I A.D. (lettering). Photo. Copied by Kubitschek (K.V.7; Abklatsch 9); recorded by the MAMA expedition; not reported subsequently. Published by Kubitschek & Reichel, AAWW 1893, 101, no. 6, on which Robert, RPh 18, 1944, 53, BE 1943:68; by Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA 8, no. 562, with photograph, whence Robert, Hellenica 13, 193 n.2, BE 1966:407, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 487.

entry.title: Dedication of trapeza by Kallikrates son of Molossos
entry.summary: A long low white marble block (1.31 × 0.27 × 0.70) with moulding above and below the face. Inscribed on the moulding which is badly worn and flaking. Date: First to second centuries A.D. (prosopography, lettering). Photo. Recorded by K&R (KV.facing 1); by the MAMA expedition in 1934; recorded by the NYU expedition. Published by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 8. 445 whence Lane, Berytus 15, 1964, 27, no. 2, Lane, Corpus Mon. Dei Menis I no. 119 (PH), SEG 1980.1245, McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 165.

entry.title: Consolatory decree for three brothers
entry.summary: Two adjoining white marble blocks: i, to left 1.90 × 0.85 x depth not measurable; ii (to right) 1.42 × 0.85 x depth not measurable. Inscribed in three recessed panels, 0.80, 0.79 and 0.80; a and b on block i, c on block ii. The blocks are complete on all sides; the texts must therefore have begun on blocks above. Date: First to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. a-c copied by Deering (15-16, no. 47); copied by Fellows. b copied by Kubitschek (KV.6); c (lines 11-23) copied by Doublet and Deschamps. All recorded by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition in 1977 (MB). Published by Fellows, a, no. 24; b nos. 25, 26; c no. 27, whence CIG 2775b, 2775c, 2775d Published by Leake from Deering, no. 20a, 20b, 20c, whence Bailie nos. 52, 53, 54; b by Texier no. 1; c corrected by Doublet & Deschamps 13; a-c, whence Buresch, RhMus. 49 (1894), 424-60, whence L. Robert, EE 19-20. Published by Cormack from the MAMA records, MAMA 412, whence Hellenica 13, 49, 181; McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 21.

entry.title: Honours for anonymous
entry.summary: Fragment from the right side of a white marble block (0.315 × 0.28 × 0.305). Inscribed on one face. Date: mid first century A.D (prosopography, spelling). Photo. Excavated by the NYU expedition (Walls 7). Unpublished.

entry.title: Honours for Aristokles Molossos
entry.summary: White marble statue base without moulding (0.545 × 0.92 × depth not measurable); the block is broken across the lower face and the surface is badly weathered. Inscribed on the face. Date: Mid-first century A.D. (prosopography; but the lettering looks later). Photo. Recorded by Radet; by the MAMA expedition; and by the NYU expedition in 1973. On each occasion the stone had become more damaged. Published by Radet, BCH 14 (1890), 236-237, no. 11 ; from the MAMA records by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 468 whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 239.

Recorded by Doublet and Deschamps; Kubitschek and Reichel (no notebook reference); by the MAMA expedition; and by the NYU expedition in 1973. Published by Doublet and Deschamps, BCH 14 (1890), no. 11; from the MAMA record and Kubitschek and Reichel by Cormack, MAMA 8, no. 467 whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 331.

Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition (Walls 131). Unpublished.

entry.summary: Fragment from a white marble upper moulding (0.35 × 0.17 × 0.13). Inscribed on the moulding. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (lettering; cutting). Photos. Excavated by the NYU expedition (76.53). Unpublished.

entry.title: Funerary honours for anonymous, pancratiast
entry.summary: Five fragments, which do not join, from a sarcophagus front. a. Left side fragment (1.11 x 0.58 x 1.28) with lower edge surviving; b. fragment from ?right side, without top or bottom edges (0.64 x 0.40 x 0.18); c. fragment without edges (0.17 x 0.22 x 0.21); d. fragment without edges (0.18 x 0.23 x 0.19); e. fragment broken on all sides (0.15 x 0.28 x 0.13) with traces of cement on the face from re-use. Inscribed on the face and within several of the wreaths, which are 0.18 in diameter. a. ll.2-5, 8-10, 14-16 within wreaths; b. ll.3-6, 10 ff. within wreaths; c. within a wreath; d. inscribed above a wreath, the upper edge of which survives, chipped; e. inscribed within a wreath. Date: Second to third centuries A.D. (terminology, lettering). Photos. a., the left side fragment, recorded by Reichel (R I, 19); by Gaudin (116); by the MAMA expedition; by the NYU expedition. b., c., d. (excavation inventory nos 70.220, 72.493, 76.39) and e. recorded by the current expedition. a. published by Reinach, from Gaudin's squeeze, no. 148; by J. M. R. Cormack, from the MAMA records, MAMA VIII.423, whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 346; all fragments published by Roueché, PPA 71.

entry.title: Fragmentary honours
entry.summary: Part of a fluted white marble column of oval section, probably cut from an earlier monument from which it retained the right side of an inscribed tabella ansata (die, 0.12 × 0.235). Inscribed on one surface. Date: Second to fourth centuries A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition in 1975 (Walls 130). Unpublished.

entry.title: Honours for Kallimorphos, flautist
entry.summary: White marble statue base shaft; a stray fragment from the upper right corner of ll.1-7 survives (0.315 x 0.205 x 0.11). Inscribed on the face; the text must have begun on a crowning feature. Date: 117-38 A.D (contests). Photo. Copied by William Sherard in 1705 (BM Add. 10101 f.40-1). A fragment found by the NYU expedition. Published from Sherard's copy by Boeckh, CIG 2810; by Roueché, Performers and Partisans, 67.

entry.title: Fragmentary honours, third century, from SW Walls
entry.summary: Piece from the upper moulding of a white marble statue base or statue base capital (0.21 × 0.17 × 0.11). Inscribed on the fascia. Date: Third century A.D. (lettering). Photo. Recorded by the NYU expedition (76.41). Unpublished.

entry.title: Place inscriptions of Leon and Philippos
entry.summary: Two adjacent white marble masonry blocks. i on the block to the left, ii on that to the right, which is cracked. Date: Fifth to sixth centuries A.D., or later (content). Photo. Copied by Reichel (9 June 1893, R.I.20); by the NYU expedition. Published by Grégoire, IGC. 257ter, from Reichel; by Roueché, Aphrodisias in Late Antiquity no. 211 whence McCabe PHI Aphrodisias 781, 787.
